com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples

com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples Class Reference

#include <IAudioSamples.h>

Inheritance diagram for com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples:

[legend]
Collaboration diagram for com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples:

[legend]

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A set of raw (decoded) samples, plus a timestamp for when to play those samples relative to other items in a given IContainer.

The timestamp value in decoded data is always in Microseonds.

Definition at line 37 of file IAudioSamples.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::Format

The format we use to represent audio.

Today only FMT_S16 (signed integer 16-bit audio) is supported.

Enumerator:
FMT_NONE 
FMT_U8 
FMT_S16 
FMT_S24 
FMT_S32 
FMT_FLT

virtual uint32_t com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::getNumSamples (  )  [pure virtual]

Get the number of samples in this video.

For example, if you have 100 bytes of stereo (2-channel) 16-bit audio in this buffer, there are 25 samples. If you have 100 bytes of mono (1-channel) 16-bit audio in this buffer, you have 50 samples.

Returns:
The number of samples.

Implemented in com::xuggle::xuggler::AudioSamples.

Referenced by com::xuggle::xuggler::AudioResampler::getMinimumNumSamplesRequiredInOutputSamples().

virtual uint32_t com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::getMaxBufferSize (  )  [pure virtual]

Returns:
Maximum number of bytes that can be put in this buffer. To get the number of samples you can put in this IAudioSamples instance, do the following num_samples = getMaxBufferSize() / (getSampleSize())

Implemented in com::xuggle::xuggler::AudioSamples.

virtual uint32_t com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::getSampleSize (  )  [pure virtual]

Returns:
Number of bytes in a single sample of audio (including channels). You can also get this by getSampleBitDepth()*getChannels()/8.

virtual void com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::setComplete ( bool  complete,
uint32_t  numSamples,
int32_t  sampleRate,
int32_t  channels,
Format  format,
int64_t  pts 
) [pure virtual]

Call this if you modify the samples and are now done.

This updates the pertinent information in the structure.

Parameters:
complete Is this set of samples complete?
numSamples Number of samples in this update (note that 4 shorts of 16-bit audio in stereo is actually 1 sample).
sampleRate The sample rate (in Hz) of this set of samples.
channels The number of channels in this set of samples.
format The sample-format of this set of samples.
pts The presentation time stamp of the starting sample in this buffer. Caller must ensure pts is in units of 1/1,000,000 of a second

Implemented in com::xuggle::xuggler::AudioSamples.

virtual int32_t com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::setSample ( uint32_t  sampleIndex,
int32_t  channel,
Format  format,
int32_t  sample 
) [pure virtual]

Sets the sample at the given index and channel to the sample.

In theory we assume input is the given Format, and will convert if needed, but right now we only support FMT_S16 anyway.

Parameters:
sampleIndex The zero-based index into the set of samples
channel The zero-based channel number. If this set of samples doesn't have that given channel, an error is returned.
format The format of the given sample
sample The actual sample
Returns:
>= 0 on success; -1 on error.

Implemented in com::xuggle::xuggler::AudioSamples.

virtual int32_t com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::getSample ( uint32_t  sampleIndex,
int32_t  channel,
Format  format 
) [pure virtual]

Get the sample at the given sampleIndex and channel, and return it in the asked for format.

Parameters:
sampleIndex The zero-based index into this set of samples.
channel The zero-based channel to get the sample from
format The format to return in
Returns:
The sample if available. If that sample is not available (e.g. because the channel doesn't exist, or the samples have not been setComplete(bool, uint32_t, int32_t, int32_t, Format, int64_t)), then this method returns 0. It is up to the caller to ensure the inputs are valid given that 0 is also a valid sample value.

Implemented in com::xuggle::xuggler::AudioSamples.

uint32_t com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::findSampleBitDepth ( Format  format  )  [static]

A convenience method that returns the # of bits in a given format.

Be aware that right now this library only supports 16-bit audio.

Parameters:
format The format you want to find the number of bits in.
Returns:
The number of bits (not bytes) in the passed in format.

IAudioSamples * com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::make ( uint32_t  numSamples,
uint32_t  numChannels 
) [static]

Get a new audio samples buffer.

Note that any buffers this objects needs will be lazily allocated (i.e. we won't actually grab all the memory until we need it).

Parameters:
numSamples The minimum number of samples you're going to want to put in this buffer. We may (and probably will) return a larger buffer, but you cannot assume that.
numChannels The number of channels in the audio you'll want to put in this buffer.
Returns:
A new object, or null if we can't allocate one.

Reimplemented in com::xuggle::xuggler::AudioSamples.

int64_t com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::samplesToDefaultPts ( int64_t  samples,
int  sampleRate 
) [static]

Converts a number of samples at a given sampleRate into Microseconds.

Parameters:
samples Number of samples.
sampleRate sample rate that those samples are recorded at.
Returns:
number of microseconds it would take to play that audio.

Definition at line 69 of file IAudioSamples.cpp.

References com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::DEFAULT_PTS_PER_SECOND, com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::init(), and com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::NO_PTS.

Referenced by com::xuggle::xuggler::StreamCoder::decodeAudio(), com::xuggle::xuggler::StreamCoder::encodeAudio(), com::xuggle::xuggler::AudioSamples::getNextPts(), and com::xuggle::xuggler::AudioResampler::resample().

00070   {
00071     // Note: These need to always round up!  a "partial sample" actually must
00072     // be whole (and similar with time stamps).
00073     int64_t retval = Global::NO_PTS;
00074     Global::init();
00075     if (sampleRate > 0)
00076     {
00077       int64_t num = samples * Global::DEFAULT_PTS_PER_SECOND;
00078       int64_t den = sampleRate;
00079       long double calc = ((long double)num)/((long double)den);
00080       retval = (int64_t)(calc);
00081     }
00082     return retval;
00083   }

int64_t com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::defaultPtsToSamples ( int64_t  duration,
int  sampleRate 
) [static]

Converts a duration in microseconds into a number of samples, assuming a given sampleRate.

Parameters:
duration The duration in microseconds.
sampleRate sample rate that you want to use.
Returns:
The number of samples it would take (at the given sampleRate) to take duration microseconds to play.

Definition at line 86 of file IAudioSamples.cpp.

References com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::DEFAULT_PTS_PER_SECOND, com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::init(), and com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::NO_PTS.

00087   {
00088     int64_t retval = 0;
00089     Global::init();
00090     if (duration != Global::NO_PTS)
00091     {
00092       int64_t num = duration * sampleRate;
00093       int64_t den = Global::DEFAULT_PTS_PER_SECOND;
00094       long double calc = ((long double)num)/((long double)den);
00095       retval = (int64_t)(calc);
00096     }
00097     return retval;
00098   }

IAudioSamples * com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::make ( com::xuggle::ferry::IBuffer *  buffer,
int  channels,
IAudioSamples::Format  format 
) [static]

Creates an IAudioSamples object by wrapping an object.

If you are decoding into this buffer, the buffer must be at least 192k*channels large (an FFmpeg requirement) or the decodeAudio call on IStreamCoder will fail with an error. If you are encoding from, any size should do.

Parameters:
buffer the buffer to wrap
channels the number of channels of audio you will put it the buffer
format the audio sample format
Returns:
a new IAudioSamples object, or null on error.

Reimplemented in com::xuggle::xuggler::AudioSamples.

uint32_t  numChannels,

) [static]

Get a new audio samples buffer.

Parameters:

numChannels The number of channels in the audio you'll want to put in this buffer.

Returns:
A new object, or null if we can't allocate one.
